title: Open Letter: Can we have an update on Riot OCE?
body:
In the past 6-ish months, there's been a lot of moving and shifting within the relatively small Riot OCE Office, and while one could assume these are all positive changes or a change in direction, it's also easy to understand why they can be interpreted as a bad thing. So, let's go over the main points.


In 2017, a notable number of Oceanic based casters moved away to different regions, to focus their casting abilities there. Specifically, Korea, Japan, and China. While losing numbers in the office isn't a great thing, they were still going to be working on the game, in their career path, and have a high chance of working with their colleagues again in the future. So, the casters were congradulated, and let off to be amazing elsewhere.

Just after PAX Australia, 2 Riot employees departed Riot Games. Marauder ( Community Manager ) and Riot Loote ( Events ).

Then, this month, 2 more prolific Rioters departed. Loatheyy ( Player management / pro wrangler ) and MasterMirkinen ( Head of Riot OCE ).

This is just from memory.

I've had decent conversations with all of the above Rioters, and actual friendships with half of them. I have full faith they'll be fine, but... what about Riot OCE?

I'm curious as to what it's been like since the office got smaller. I can't imagine the Sydney office being the same without MasterMirkinen's radiating smile. While responsibilities and tasks can be delegated, pure manpower and morale look like they're going to be at a pretty low point. How is everyone doing? Is Riot downscaling purposefully to facilitate their broadcasting facilities? Is Riot handling Hiring processes internally to bring in more members? WHO'S GOING TO STOCK THE VENDING MACHINES NOW?!

All the love, to Rioters past and present.
That community guy,
~Jason
